Class PurchaseDAO

java.lang.Object
com.lucas.ticketsalesmanager.persistence.PurchaseDAO
public class PurchaseDAO extends Object
The PurchaseDAO class provides data access methods for managing purchase data. It handles operations such as adding, canceling, reactivating, and listing purchases stored in a JSON file.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PurchaseDAO()
    Constructs a PurchaseDAO instance, initializing the data access object with the specified file path and type for purchase lists.

  • Method Details

    • addPurchase

      public void addPurchase(User user, Ticket ticket, Payment paymentMethod) throws jakarta.mail.MessagingException
      Adds a new purchase to the purchase list.
      Parameters:
      user - The user making the purchase.
      ticket - The ticket being purchased.
      paymentMethod - The payment method used for the purchase.
      Throws:
      jakarta.mail.MessagingException - if there is an error sending the purchase confirmation email.

    • cancelPurchase

      public void cancelPurchase(Purchase purchase)
      Cancels a specified purchase.
      Parameters:
      purchase - The purchase to be canceled.

    • reactivatePurchase

      public void reactivatePurchase(Purchase purchase)
      Reactivates a previously canceled purchase.
      Parameters:
      purchase - The purchase to be reactivated.

    • listPurchasesByEvent

      public List<Purchase> listPurchasesByEvent(Event event)
      Lists all purchases associated with a specific event.
      Parameters:
      event - The event for which purchases are to be listed.
      Returns:
      A list of purchases related to the specified event, or an empty list if none found.

    • listPurchases

      public List<Purchase> listPurchases()
      Lists all purchases.
      Returns:
      A list of all purchases, or an empty list if no purchases are found.

    • findPurchasesByUser

      public List<Purchase> findPurchasesByUser(User user)
      Finds all purchases made by a specific user.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose purchases are to be found.
      Returns:
      A list of purchases made by the specified user, or an empty list if none found.

    • findPurchasesByTicket

      public List<Purchase> findPurchasesByTicket(Ticket ticket)
      Finds all purchases associated with a specific ticket.
      Parameters:
      ticket - The ticket for which purchases are to be found.
      Returns:
      A list of purchases associated with the specified ticket, or an empty list if none found.

    • findPurchasesByPaymentMethod

      public List<Purchase> findPurchasesByPaymentMethod(Payment paymentMethod)
      Finds all purchases made using a specific payment method.
      Parameters:
      paymentMethod - The payment method used for the purchases.
      Returns:
      A list of purchases made with the specified payment method, or an empty list if none found.

    • findPurchaseByPurchaseDate

      public Purchase findPurchaseByPurchaseDate(Date purchaseDate)
      Finds a purchase by its purchase date.
      Parameters:
      purchaseDate - The date of the purchase to find.
      Returns:
      The Purchase object if found, or null if not found.

    • removePurchase

      public void removePurchase(Purchase purchase)
      Removes a specified purchase from the purchase list.
      Parameters:
      purchase - The purchase to be removed.

    • updatePurchase

      public void updatePurchase(Purchase purchase)
      Updates an existing purchase in the purchase list.
      Parameters:
      purchase - The purchase with updated information.
